channel.title: 彭博-市场

item.title: 据国际劳工组织统计，私营经济中的强迫劳动每年产生 2 360 亿美元的非法利润。
item.description:
Forced labor in the private economy generates $236 billion in illegal profits every year, according to the International Labour Organization https://t.co/TJxbgoWPHA

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) March 19, 2024

item.title: 随着日本央行 17 年来首次提高利率，从东京到新加坡的交易大厅里回荡着一个词--"终于"。
item.description:
As the Bank of Japan raised interest rates for the first time in 17 years, one word echoed across trading floors from Tokyo to Singapore — "finally" https://t.co/BtYLmlQ67F

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) March 19, 2024

item.title: 英伟达将与诺和诺德基金会（诺和诺德背后的企业基金会）合作，在丹麦建造一台人工智能超级计算机
item.description:

item.title: 瑞士钟表月度出口量三年来第二次下降，主要原因是中国和香港的出货量减少
item.description:

item.title: 由于监管机构警告市场泡沫日益严重，印度股市将抹去今年的涨幅
item.description:

item.title: 美国银行的一项调查显示，投资者正在抢购欧洲和新兴市场的股票，而牺牲了美国和科技市场的股票
item.description:
Investors are snapping up stocks in Europe and emerging markets at the expense of the US and tech, according to a Bank of America survey https://t.co/8lZ6W6C4rc

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) March 19, 2024

item.title: 日本自 2007 年以来首次加息，结束了世界上最后一次负利率政策，但其鸽派基调削弱了日元。无论您是计划去日本度假，还是居住在日本，以下是最新举措对您的影响
item.description:
Japan has ended the world’s last negative interest rate policy with its first rate hike since 2007 — but its dovish tone weakened the yen.

Whether you’re planning a vacation there or if you live in the country, here’s how the latest move will impact you https://t.co/8w6927EC1s pic.twitter.com/wsoUNG0uIl

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) March 19, 2024

item.title: 阿斯利康达成高达 24 亿美元收购 Fusion 制药公司的协议，力图改变癌症治疗方法
item.description:

item.title: DFS Furniture 将其年度税前利润展望下调三分之一，并警告称红海的干扰可能会将利润推迟到下一财政年度。

item.title: 据当地媒体报道，政府检察官建议，因涉嫌贿赂政府官员而在 120 亿美元欺诈案中受审的越南房地产大亨应被判处死刑
item.description:

item.title: 中国政府债券近期的牛市在休整一周后卷土重来，这表明交易员们正在接受政策制定者关于涨势过猛的暗示性指引
item.description:
A recent bull run in China’s government bonds is making a comeback after a one-week break, a sign that traders are getting over policymakers’ implicit guidance that the rally has gone too far https://t.co/j7vrA1GdBb

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) March 19, 2024

item.title: 国家主席习近平参观了中国南部城市长沙的一家电池材料公司，他正努力推动一项新的工业政策，以促进经济增长。
item.description:
President Xi Jinping visited a battery materials company in the southern Chinese city of Changsha as he seeks to promote a new industrial policy to boost economic growth https://t.co/M80GhnAxgc

item.title: 由于对巴勒斯坦工人的禁令，以色列的建筑工地处于闲置状态。这使以色列的风向标建筑业变成了危机中心
item.description:
Building sites in Israel are idle due to a ban on Palestinian workers.

That's turned its bellwether construction industry into a crisis epicenter https://t.co/UtGDUiYQGZ

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) March 19, 2024

item.title: 拜登和内塔尼亚胡试图缓和因以色列加沙战争而异常公开的争吵，但几乎没有迹象表明将他们推开的国内政治压力正在缓解

Biden and Netanyahu sought to turn down the heat in their unusually public feud over Israel’s war in Gaza, but there was little sign the domestic political pressures that have pushed them apart were easing https://t.co/EJNekONUfo

item.title: 瑞士国家银行行长托马斯-乔丹 2023 年的薪酬为 95.17 万瑞士法郎，成为全球薪酬最高的央行行长之一

item.title: 乌克兰入侵后，流入印度的俄罗斯原油激增，这个欧佩克+产油国仍是这个南亚国家的最大供应国，但美国制裁的收紧导致货物滞留，折扣也有所收窄
item.description:
Russian crude flows to India surged after the invasion of Ukraine and the OPEC+ producer is still the biggest supplier to the South Asian nation, but tighter US sanctions have stranded cargoes and discounts have narrowed https://t.co/dXPQYP06Jc

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) March 19, 2024

item.title: 克罗地亚总统佐兰-米拉诺维奇（Zoran Milanovic）在最高法院阻止他参加下个月的总理选举后，指责最高法院阻挠人民的意愿。
item.description:
